verses.verse: Dead <WH4194> flies <WH2070> cause the ointment <WH8081> of the apothecary <WH7543> to send forth <WH5042> a stinking smell <WH887>: so does a little <WH4592> wickedness <WH5531> him that is in reputation <WH3368> for wisdom <WH2451> and honor <WH3519>.
A wise man <WH2450>'s heart <WH3820> is at his right hand <WH3225>; but a fool <WH3684>'s heart <WH3820> at his left <WH8040>.
Yes also <WH5530>, when he that is a fool walks <WH1980> by the way <WH1870>, his wisdom <WH3820> fails <WH2638> him <WH559>, and he says to every one that he is a fool <WH5530>.
If the spirit <WH7307> of the ruler <WH4910> rise up <WH5927> against you <WH3240>, leave not your place <WH4725>; for yielding <WH4832> pacifies <WH3240> great <WH1419> offenses <WH2399>.
There is <WH3426> a evil <WH7451> which I have seen <WH7200> under the sun <WH8121>, as a error <WH7684> which proceeds <WH3318> from <WH6440> the ruler <WH7989>:
Wickedness <WH5529> is set <WH5414> in great <WH7227> dignity <WH4791>, and the rich <WH6223> sit <WH3427> in low place <WH8216>.
I have seen <WH7200> servants <WH5650> upon horses <WH5483>, and princes <WH8269> walking <WH1980> as servants <WH5650> upon the earth <WH776>.
He that digs <WH2658> a pit <WH1475> shall fall <WH5307> into it <WH6555>; and whoever breaks a hedge <WH1447>, a serpent <WH5175> shall bite him <WH5391>.
Whoever removes <WH5265> stones <WH68> shall be hurt <WH6087> with it <WH1234>; and he that cleaves wood <WH6086> shall be endangered thereby <WH5533>.

If the iron <WH1270> be blunt <WH6949>, and he do not sharpen <WH7043> the edge <WH6440>, then must he put <WH1396> to more strength <WH2428>: but wisdom <WH2451> is profitable <WH3504> to direct <WH3787>.
Surely the serpent <WH5175> will bite <WH5391> without enchantment <WH3908>; and a babbler <WH3956> is no better <WH3504>.
The words <WH1697> of a wise man <WH2450>'s mouth <WH6310> are gracious <WH2580>; but the lips <WH8193> of a fool <WH3684> will swallow up himself <WH1104>.
The beginning <WH8462> of the words <WH1697> of his mouth <WH6310> is foolishness <WH5531>: and the end <WH319> of his talk <WH6310> is mischievous <WH7451> madness <WH1948>.
A fool <WH5530> also is full <WH7235> of words <WH1697>: a man <WH120> cannot tell <WH3045> what shall be <WH310>; and what shall be after him <WH5046>, who can tell him?
The labor <WH5999> of the foolish <WH3684> wearies <WH3021> every one of them <WH3045>, because he knows not how to go <WH3212> to the city <WH5892>.
Woe <WH337> to you <WH776>, O land, when your king <WH4428> is a child <WH5288>, and your princes <WH8269> eat <WH398> in the morning <WH1242>!

Blessed <WH835> are you <WH776>, O land, when your king <WH4428> is the son <WH1121> of nobles <WH2715>, and your princes <WH8269> eat <WH398> in due season <WH6256>, for strength <WH1369>, and not for drunkenness <WH8358>!
By much slothfulness <WH6103> the building <WH4746> decays <WH4355>; and through idleness <WH8220> of the hands <WH3027> the house <WH1004> drops through <WH1811>.
A feast <WH3899> is made <WH6213> for laughter <WH7814>, and wine <WH3196> makes merry <WH8055>: but money <WH3701> answers all things <WH6030>.

Curse <WH7043> not the king <WH4428>, no not in your thought <WH4093>; and curse <WH7043> not the rich <WH6223> in your bedroom <WH2315>: for a bird <WH5775> of the air <WH8064> shall carry <WH3212> the voice <WH6963>, and that which has <WH1167> wings <WH3671> shall tell <WH5046> the matter <WH1697>.
